txt.en: Great steeds are the pride of Harwick, and these horses feed on only the finest of hay, grasses, and reeds.
'Ah! Marsh reeds. Thank you -- these are the horses' favourite food. Supposedly it tastes sweet to them; I have tried it, and I can assure you it does not taste sweet to me. Ah, well.'
Great steeds are the pride of Harwick, and these horses feed on only the finest of hay, grasses, and reeds.
Marsh reeds tend to grow along the edges of standing water, and prefer the rich soil near bogs.\n\nYou should collect marsh reeds, the favourite food of Harwick's horses.
Bring the marsh reeds to CÃ©olstan at the Harwick Stables
The guard of the stables waits for you to return.
